definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
Massive Ordinance Air Blast (MOAB), a powerful American bomb
pinyin: da4 xing2 kong1 bao4 zha4 dan4
qi4 che1 zha4 dan4 shi4 jian4

definition: Massive Ordinance Air Blast (MOAB), or Mother of All Bombs, a powerful American bomb
Aviation Thermobaric Bomb of Increased Power (ATBIP), or Father of All Bombs, a powerful Russian bomb

pinyin: zi4 sha1 zha4 dan4 sha1 shou3

sentences.english: For that reason, the explosives unit maintains a huge supply of potential bomb making ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 因此，爆破小組保存了許多可能製造炸彈的材料。

sentences.english: He says they'll use suicide bombers in their attacks.
sentences.chinese: 他說他們會在襲擊中使用自殺式炸彈。

sentences.english: I can rig it so it detonates on impact.
sentences.chinese: 我可以改裝讓炸彈立即引爆。

sentences.english: They dropped three bombs without hitting any of the ships .
sentences.chinese: 他們投下三顆炸彈，但一艘船也沒炸着。

sentences.english: Witnesses said the bomb hit the refugees as they were sheltering under trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者稱，難民在樹林和樹叢中避難時遭到炸彈襲擊。

sentences.english: A car-bomb attack scene in one of the streets in Baghdad.
sentences.chinese: 巴格達街頭一處汽車炸彈襲擊現場。

sentences.english: The battle broke out after international troops struck a roadside bomb in Wardak province.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥爆發後，國際部隊在瓦爾達克省的路邊炸彈襲擊。

sentences.english: The bomb blew all the windows out.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈把所有窗門都炸燬了。

sentences.english: A second bomb was found and defused near the scene of the blast.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸點附近發現的第二枚炸彈已被拆除。
他那輛被安有炸彈的汽車爆炸了。

sentences.english: Last night a bomb ripped apart the train in which we had been travelling.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜裏一顆炸彈將我們乘坐的火車炸得四分五裂。

sentences.english: And this time too the bombproved a dud.
sentences.chinese: 而且這一次，這枚炸彈又被證實爲啞彈。

sentences.english: The bombs would inflict great damage on the military and economic infrastructure of Serbia.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈將對塞爾維亞的軍事和經濟設施造成嚴重破壞。

sentences.english: Forgetting it was the bomb, he opened it and was blown to bits.
sentences.chinese: 而他忘了那是炸彈，於是開信，被炸成碎片。

sentences.english: The dynamite and the fuses are strapped along sticks of bamboo before being shoved into pre-drilled holes.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈和引信綁在長竹竿上，放入事先磚好的洞裏。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to shoot (a projectile)/to fire (a rocket)/to launch/to emit (a particle)/to discharge/emanation/emission
